perturbation.original_text: 7.1 The SENDER undertakes the obligation to pay irrevocably and unconditionally the Service for the Contracted Capacity, twenty (20)  calendar days at the latest, after ECOPETROL files in the offices of the SENDER the invoice for the provision of the Service.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1 The SENDER undertakes the obligation to pay irrevocably and unconditionally the Service for the Contracted Capacity, sixty (60) calendar days at the latest, after ECOPETROL files in the offices of the SENDER the invoice for the provision of the Service.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract stipulates that payment must be made within 20 calendar days of the invoice date.  Extending this to 60 days contradicts standard business practices and possibly regulations around payment terms, which generally require prompt payment. This may violate laws concerning fair and timely payment for services rendered.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates prompt payment laws or regulations; varies by jurisdiction (likely United States law).

perturbation.original_text: 7.9 The shipment tax shall be invoiced in Colombian pesos upon obtaining the corresponding liquidation from the Ministry of Mines and  Energy and shall be paid to ECOPETROL by the SENDER, within the fifteen (15) calendar days after ECOPETROL files in the offices of the  SENDER the corresponding bills or invoices.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.9 The shipment tax shall be invoiced in Colombian pesos upon obtaining the corresponding liquidation from the Ministry of Mines and Energy and shall be paid to ECOPETROL by the SENDER, within the five (5) calendar days after ECOPETROL files in the offices of the SENDER the corresponding bills or invoices.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the payment timeframe for the shipment tax from 15 to 5 calendar days could violate regulations granting businesses reasonable time to process and remit taxes.  This creates an unreasonably short deadline that conflicts with typical tax compliance standards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates tax regulations, depending on the jurisdiction and specific laws governing tax remittance periods.

perturbation.original_text: 8.2 Otherwise, In order to guarantee compliance with all and each of the obligations of the SENDER under the Contract hereof, including but  without being limited to the payment of the Fee, the SENDER is obliged to constitute in favor of ECOPETROL and to deliver within ten (10)  business days after the subscription of the Contract hereof for the amount indicated in the Specific Conditions (hereinafter, the "Bond"): a) A performance policy for the payment of Services issued by an insurance policy legally established in the country, governed by the  General Clauses of ECOPETROL indicated in Annex 3; or    b) An irrevocable stand-by letter of credit at first requirement, issued by (i) a banking establishment authorized to operate in Colombia  with AAA credit rating for its long-term debt in pesos, o (ii) a foreign financial entity with representation or a confirming and payment  bank in Colombia, with risk credit of long term debt in dollars no less than the rating for the foreign sovereign debt of Colombia issued  pursuant to the International Standby Practices (ISP98) of the International Chamber of Commerce, for which, it may be used the form  contained in Annex 4 of the Contract hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2 Otherwise, In order to guarantee compliance with all and each of the obligations of the SENDER under the Contract hereof, including but  without being limited to the payment of the Fee, the SENDER is obliged to constitute in favor of ECOPETROL and to deliver within one (1)  business days after the subscription of the Contract hereof for the amount indicated in the Specific Conditions (hereinafter, the "Bond"):    a) A performance policy for the payment of Services issued by an insurance policy legally established in the country, governed by the General Clauses of ECOPETROL indicated in Annex 3; or    b) An irrevocable stand-by letter of credit at first requirement, issued by (i) a banking establishment authorized to operate in Colombia  with AAA credit rating for its long-term debt in pesos, o (ii) a foreign financial entity with representation or a confirming and payment  bank in Colombia, with risk credit of long term debt in dollars no less than the rating for the foreign sovereign debt of Colombia issued  pursuant to the International Standby Practices (ISP98) of the International Chamber of Commerce, for which, it may be used the form  contained in Annex 4 of the Contract hereof.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the timeframe to deliver the bond from 10 to 1 business day is an unreasonable deadline, this makes it impractical for the sender to comply, potentially violating regulations requiring fairness in contract terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates contract law principles requiring reasonable terms and opportunity to comply.
